III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During an incident that occurred on 02/26/2025 Youth A was held
down and choked by staff.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 02/27/2025 and had no
additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 02/27/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth A
recalled the morning of 02/26/2025 when he had asked Staff 3 for
batteries and Staff 3 did not respond to him. Youth A recalled
Youth B interrupting him and he started to argue with Youth
B. This occurred near both of their bedrooms in the
hallway. Youth A believed it was Staff 2 that restrained Youth A
and moved Youth A to his own bedroom. Youth A did not see or
interact with Youth B after this occurred. Youth A recalled laying
on his side on his bed, with Staff 2 putting his fist on the side of
Youth A’s face and holding it down against the bed. Youth A
recalled Staff 2 getting up and standing in Youth A’s
doorway. Youth A was upset and recalled throwing one of his
shoes at his window. Youth A picked up another shoe and Staff 2
took it out of his hand. Youth A told Staff 2 to leave him alone,
and Staff 2 responded by stating “If you hit me, I am going to
choke you.” Youth A tried to take his shoe back from Staff
2. Staff 2 proceeded to put his hand on Youth A’s neck and
pushed Youth A backwards. Youth A began to calm down,
transitioning from being angry to being sad and crying. He stated
Staff 2 backed away from Youth A. Youth A recalled hearing Staff
2 state to Staff 1 that they would need to restrain Youth A. Youth
A believed Staff 1 then came in the room and took Youth A’s bible
2

that had been laying nearby. Staff 1 told Youth A to stop touching
him, and if Youth A did not, Staff 1 would throw the bible out of the
window. Youth A recalled seeing Staff 2 open Youth A’s bedroom
window and Staff 1 threw the bible out of the window. Youth A
commented he had not thrown anything out of his window himself
and he had not touched his bible that morning. Youth A recalled
running out of the room down the hallway, and he proceeded to
pull the fire alarm. Youth A could not remember exactly what
happened next, only that law enforcement was at the facility and
spoke with him.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 02/27/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1
recalled getting involved in the incident when Youth A was inside
of his room and Staff 2 was standing near Youth A’s doorway to
the bedroom. Staff 1 saw Youth A throwing items out of his own
bedroom window. Staff 1 believed Youth A was also threatening
to jump out of the window. Staff 1 described seeing Staff 2
attempt to use proxemics to get closer to Youth A, but Youth A ran
out of the room past Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 saw Youth A pull
the fire alarm in the hallway and run downstairs. After this
occurred Staff 2 closed Youth A’s bedroom window. Staff 1
denied ever seeing Youth A’s bible at any point during the
incident. He also denied ever seeing Staff 2 have any physical
interaction with Youth A. He recalled Staff 2 calmly trying to
verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 1 confirmed Youth B was not
involved in the incident from the point in time he became
involved.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 02/27/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 2
recalled interacting with Youth A the previous morning when
Youth A became upset with Youth B while in the hallway near their
bedrooms. Staff 2 walked Youth A to his bedroom in an attempt
to reduce the chances of the interaction escalating further. Staff 2
described this as a guided assist, holding Youth A’s upper arms
and Youth A walking with him to the bedroom. Staff 2 believed
Youth A did this under his own power and did not recall Youth A
resisting him or trying to further interact with Youth B. Once Youth
A went into his room, Staff 2 believed he stayed near the
doorway. Youth A became more upset and began to throw items
around the room. These items included shoes and books. Youth
A was pulling on the opening mechanism of his bedroom
window. Youth A proceeded to jump on his bed and slid his body
in between the bed and wall. Staff 2 saw Youth A get the window
open and then Youth A proceeded to throw items out of the
3

window, including shoes, clothing and books. Staff 2 denied ever
touching any of Youth A’s items or throwing them out of the
window. He recalled seeing Youth A’s bible sitting on Youth A’s
bed but was not sure if Youth A threw that out of the window with
the other items. Staff 2 stated his position had not changed at that
point, he was continuing to stand in the doorway of Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 2 recalled this occurring for seconds before Youth
A moved away from the window, and Staff 2 was able to close the
window. Staff 2 recalled Staff 3 approaching him and witnessing
part of the situation. He was not sure how long she was there
for. Staff 1 and Staff 4 came as well and became involved. Staff
2 recalled telling Staff 4 not to attempt to touch or restrain Youth
A, as he did not believe that would be beneficial. Staff 2 recalled
Youth A running past them into the hallway, pulling the fire alarm
and running down the stairs. Staff 2 overheard Youth A yell out
“He choked me” as Youth A ran down the stairs to the main floor
of the facility, and he believed Youth A was referring to Staff
2. Staff 2 knew other staff were following Youth A and others
were already downstairs, so he chose to stay away from Youth A
for the rest of the morning after this occurred. Staff 2 denied ever
physically harming Youth A during the entirety of the incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 02/27/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
reported standing near the door during the part of the incident
where Staff 2 and Youth A were in Youth A’s bedroom. She
recalled seeing Youth A jump on his own bed and then threaten to
jump out of his bedroom window. Staff 3 saw Staff 2 properly
supervising and interacting with Youth A, keeping his physical
distance and attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 3
never saw Staff 2 touch Youth A. Staff 3 never heard Staff 2 state
anything threatening to Youth A. She also never heard reference
of Youth A’s bible while she was involved. Staff 3 switched places
with Staff 4 and did not see any more of the interaction between
Staff 2 and Youth A, until Youth A ran past her in the hallway and
proceeded to pull the fire alarm.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
03/19/2025. He recalled early in the morning youth had gotten up
and were getting ready for school. Staff 4 walked up the stairs
and heard a commotion from Youth A’s bedroom, and when he
arrived, he saw Staff 1 and Staff 2 in the room with Youth A. At
that time Youth A was verbally escalated and Staff 4 recalled
hearing him threaten Staff 2 multiple times. He recalled seeing
Youth A near his bedroom window and Youth A was throwing
items outside of it. Staff 4 believed Youth A never actually made a
4

move that made it appear that he was going to climb out the
window. Staff 4 recalled seeing Staff 2 attempt to use proxemics
to get in between Youth A and the window, and Staff 4 was not
sure if Staff 2 had any contact with Youth A. Staff 4 commented
that this was brief, and Youth A moved away from the window and
then ran outside of the room. Staff 4 never heard Staff 2 state
anything threatening to Youth A and did not see Staff 2 physically
harm Youth A in any way.
Video reviewed:
• Video footage dated 02/26/2025 beginning at 6:55am was
reviewed. The hallway containing all the youth bedrooms
was visible and staff and youth were coming and
going. Youth A and Youth B were seen talking in the
hallway. Staff 2 came to them from the far end of the
hallway and placed his hand on Youth A’s back and guided
him to Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2 and Youth A entered the
bedroom and were not seen for approximately one
minute. Staff 2 was then seen standing in the doorway of
the room with Youth A still inside. Other staff and youth
pass by Youth A’s room. Staff 2 re-entered Youth A’s
bedroom at 7:02am. Staff 3 shortly thereafter and then Staff
1 came to the doorway about three minutes later. Staff 1
stood at the doorway with Youth A and Staff 2 inside when
Staff 4 joined them at the doorway at about 7:07am. Staff 1
and Staff 4 could be seen verbally interacting with someone
inside the room. Staff 4 entered the room at about
7:09am. Youth A could be seen quickly moving out of his
bedroom at 7:11am with staff following him down the
hallway.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 02/26/2025 was
provided and reviewed. This description of the incident
was consistent with staff interviews.
• Facility policy & procedures titled “Discipline & Behavior
Management Policy” was provided and
reviewed. Prohibited practices included physical abuse or
verbal abuse of youth by staff.
• Training documentation for Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
provided and reviewed. Staff 1 was up to date on his
behavior management training as of 10/30/2024 and Staff 2
as of 08/28/2024.
• Staff discipline documentation for Staff 1 was provided and
reviewed. He had been written up for personal cell phone
5

use while supervising youth, failing to transport youth to an
outing and sleeping on shift on one occasion.
• Staff discipline documentation for Staff 2 was provided and
reviewed. He had been written up in the past for
participating in an inappropriate conversation around youth
and repeated absence/tardiness concerns.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as staff interviews and
documentation reviewed were consistent, describing the events
that took place. Staff 2 denied having physical contact with Youth
A with exception to the guided assist to separate Youth A and
Youth B. Several staff reported they witnessed Youth A throwing
items out of his bedroom window.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
